text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) helps workers when they have lost their jobs as a result of changes in the pattern of world trade (e.g. closure of a large company or relocation of a production facility outside the EU).In this case, the application concerns 800 redundant workers at Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS, and provides for a total of € 1,131,358 to be made available to Estonia.I support the use of the money to help the laid-off workers get them back into the labor market.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report granting aid from the Globalization Adjustment Fund to support the reintegration into the labor market of 800 workers made redundant by three petrochemical companies in Estonia.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against approving EUR 1 131 358 for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The application relates to three enterprises which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products in Estonia.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this deliberation which provides for aid of € 1,131,358 for the mobilization of the Globalization Adjustment Fund, in order to help the dismissed employees of Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS andViru Keemia Grupp AS.Nonetheless, I regret that the payment of this aid is made on the basis of layoffs when it could have been invaluable in helping the company to restructure.It is urgent to act and understand that our companies are the victims of the absence of the structural reforms necessary for their adaptation to the challenges of globalization.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- Estonian companies Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS have closed down their plants in the light of recent fluctuations in the world oil market, the deterioration of the overall European international trade in fertilizers (in favor of Chinese producers) and the decline of low-cost gas regions outside Europe, orreduced production, resulting in the termination of employment contracts with many workers.Estonia has therefore submitted an application "EGF / 2016/003 EE / Petroleum and Chemicals" for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF).As Estonia has fulfilled the conditions set out in the EGF Regulation, I am in favor of Estonia receiving financial support to ensure that the redundant workers remain in the labor market.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this budgetary report giving consent to the use of EU funds. This vote was to approve EUR 1 131 358 (60% match funding) for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The money will be used for things like payments for the cost of training, language training (since there is a large number of Russian speakers), debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances and mobility allowances, etc. The application relates to 3 enterprises (which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products) in Estonia that made 1550 people redundant. UKIP opposes this use of EU dole money and British taxpayer’s having to pay for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- I voted for the text: Europe must continue to advocate its values of solidarity and to set up retraining units for these workers who have lost their jobs.This is the ninth application considered under Budget 2016, the second on the chemical industry and the first on coking and refining;it concerns the mobilization of a total amount of EUR 1,131,358 from the EGF for Estonia.This request concerns 800 dismissed workers, a new social drama.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is an instrument designed to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade.The significant transformations that have taken place in recent years have strongly involved the chemical product manufacturing sector and those of coke and petroleum refining products.My vote in favor of the Negrescu report stems from the sharing of the need to mobilize the FIGto provide assistance to the 800 workers made redundant by Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS in Estonia, particularly in the county of Ida-Virumaa.With this measure it will be possible to provide a coordinated package of tools that include training and mobility allowances as well as grants for business start-up and training, retraining and vocational training programs

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- I voted in favor.It is a fund to compensate, with mainly training actions, 800 workers laid off by four Estonian companies, most of them Russian-speaking, from the petrochemical sectors, with clear problems of competitiveness with China.As we usually say, this fund does not solve the employment problem, which can only be remedied with new investment plans with sectoral transitions, but it is a mechanism that at least provides support to the victims of these processes.Alternatively, the companies that use these funds should be monitored, because one of the risks is that in practice they could be facilitating relocation processes.It does not seem the case.But without a doubt it leads to rethinking in terms of thinking about an alternative line to these funds

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I want to thank Mr Negrescu for his work on this report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund requested by Estonia in the oil and chemical sector.It is a response to a request from Estonia to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers laid off in three companies and which will benefit 800 workers laid off.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of granting the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to the three Estonian petrochemical companies Nitrofert, Eesti Energia and Viru Keemia, and their 1,500 laid-off workers. These layoffs have arisen in particular because of the competition these companies face from Asian companies, but also because of the fall in oil prices and the increase in natural gas prices. Recall that Estonia depends to a large extent on exports of goods and services (nearly 80% of national GDP in 2015 against 43.5% for the EU-28). It would be funny, if we weren't talking about a dramatic deindustrialisation, to see that even the gurus of globalization and totalitarian free trade recognize the need for this "adjustment fund", a true symbol of social inanity and economic policy of the EU.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report authorizing the mobilization of EUR 1 131 358 from the EGF, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, for the benefit of 800 redundant workers in the oil refining and chemical manufacturing sectors in Estonia.The Globalization Adjustment Fund is a key tool for supporting workers in this time of crisis.But the EGF alone is not enough to give back a job to all those citizens who have lost it due to the crazy suicidal policies of the Union.Urgent measures are needed now in favor of employment in Europe, it is time for the EU to take the side of European workers.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report concerning the application to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, EGF / 2016/003 EE / Petroleum and Chemicals. 2016 September 28 The Commission has adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Estonia to support redundancies in Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS operating in the NACE sector (Chemicals and Chemicals). chemical products) in Ida-Virumaa County (NUTS level 2 region: EE00-Eesti), reintegration into the labor market. This is the ninth application to be considered in 2016. budget, and the second in the chemicals and chemical products sector, as well as the first in the coke and refined petroleum products sector. It concerns 800 redundant workers. The application was submitted to the Commission in 2016. 11 May 2016, additional information provided by 2016. May 25 The Commission has concluded that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF, in accordance with all the applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation.

name: Andrea BOCSKOR
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is intended to provide assistance to workers made redundant as a result of globalization, major structural changes in world trade patterns, protracted global financial and economic crisis, and the emergence of another global financial and economic crisis.for reintegration into the labor market.Estonia submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference "EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals".The request has been examined by the Commission as meeting the requirements of the relevant regulation, which is why I voted in favor of the proposal.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- As usual in the use of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, I have joined in supporting assistance in this regard as well.The European Union has adopted legislative and budgetary instruments to provide additional support to workers affected by the effects of global change, and this is appropriate solidarity support.This case concerns the emergence of redundancies in Estonia as a result of the redundancies in the economic sectors of coke and petroleum products production and the production of chemicals and chemical products.800 out of 1,550 redundancies are expected to take part in the measures.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. ‒ I endorsed this resolution on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment fund for sustaining training programmes in Estonia in order to help its workers. Moreover, I believe these funds may be a valuable tool for the development of those small economies which suffer from competition against big countries such as China.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund provides additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade. The necessary amounts are entered in the general budget of the Union as a provision. For the activation procedure, the Commission, in the event of a positive assessment of an application, submits a proposal to mobilize the Fund to the budgetary authority together with a corresponding transfer request. In case of disagreement, a trialogue procedure takes place. In September 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF for Estonia to facilitate the occupational reintegration of workers made redundant in three companies, concluding that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution. The personalized services to be offered to workers range from support for formal studies, training and professional experience to study and mobility allowances. Estonia states that the coordinated package of measures is compatible with the transition to a sustainable and resource efficient economy. The Estonian authorities have provided all necessary guarantees. Therefore, Parliament agrees with the Commission that Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution as the conditions of the EGF regulation are fulfilled.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- This report aims to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to the tune of 1.13 million euros to facilitate the professional reintegration of the 1,500 Estonian workers made redundant by companies specializing in the petrochemical industry.These companies have indeed been destabilized both by the fall in oil prices and by Chinese competition.Although we approve of the FEAM's mobilization in favor of the redundant Estonian workers, we do not hide the responsibility of the European Union in the deindustrialisation and mass unemployment of which the peoples of Europe are victims.By increasing the number of free trade agreements and tariff concessions with countries practicing social and environmental dumping, the European Union is exacerbating the unfair international competition that weighs on our businesses.I still voted in favor of this text.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this budgetary report giving consent to the use of EU funds. This vote was to approve EUR 1 131 358 (60% match funding) for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The money will be used for things like payments for the cost of training, language training (since there is a large number of Russian speakers), debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances and mobility allowances, etc. The application relates to 3 enterprises (which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products) in Estonia that made 1550 people redundant. UKIP opposes this use of EU dole money and British taxpayer’s having to pay for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ The Commission has concluded, in accordance with all applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF. Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution, which represents 60% of the total cost for personalised services consisting of support for formal studies, payment of the cost of training, training cost reimbursement for employers, labour market training, work practice, debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances relating to participation in formal studies, scholarships, transport and accommodation benefits for Estonian language training. I believe that the EGF could be a particularly valuable tool to help workers from countries with small economies and more vulnerable Union economies. I voted in favour.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing.- On 11 May 2016, Estonia submitted an application for financial assistance from the EGF following redundancies by three companies operating in the coke and petroleum refining and chemical manufacturing sectors.As a result of an increase in global competition, particularly from the east, a rise in the price of natural gas and a fall in the prices of mineral fertilizers have resulted.At the same time, there has been a decline in the price of oil and these changes have led to a crisis for many industries in the sector.Although aid to workers in difficulty has always been among the priorities of the Movement, in this case there was the risk, by voting in favor, of giving a message of support to energy production sectors that should instead be reconverted.I therefore opted for an abstention.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: in writing.- We support the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund and welcome Estonia's decision to combine two economic sectors into one regional application, as the redundancies took place in the same area, as this will reduce the administrative burden and make it possible to organize jointfor redundant workers in both sectors.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing.- We voted on the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, at the request of Estonia.The purpose of this Fund is specific and we are called upon to respond whenever reorganizations in the globalized economy directly affect workers who are at risk of losing their jobs.As this proposal was based on a similar risk, I decided to vote in favor of it for the benefit of the employees.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. - I am pleased with the decision to grant Estonia access to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in relation to the redundancies of Eesti Erga AS, Netroferts AS and Viru Keemia Group AS, based on the application submitted on 11 May last. . The application was submitted in a regional form, thus making it easier to solve problems that exist simultaneously on the same labor market and concerns 800 redundant workers. The requested contribution amounts to EUR 1 131 358, or 60% of the total costs incurred or to be met in order to guarantee personalized services, support for formal studies, payment of training costs and experience on the labor market. In front of our glassy eyes, yet another stalemate in the face of globalization flares up as the EU continues to demonstrate a systemic inability to prevent the lack of competitiveness. In fact, Eesti Erga AS, Nitroferts AS and Viru Keemia Group were forced to close a series of plants or abandon production leading to the collective termination of employment contracts because Europe has lost its leadership in global sales of chemicals. in favor of China, which instead increased its share from 9 to 35%.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the vote on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (application from Estonia – EGF/2016/003 EE/petroleum and chemicals) and noted no objections.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of this European Globalization Adjustment fund, maintaining a coherent position with the rest of the mobilization requests for this fund, since it may result in compensation for Estonian workers affected by the impacts ofcapitalist globalization.Being aware that this is nothing but a band-aid on a wound, these funds can bring relief to these workers, hence my positive vote.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund offers support to those who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade due to globalization.In light of these considerations and in view of the admissibility of Estonia's application, I voted positively to mobilize the fund in favor of redundant workers.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: signed up.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been set up to provide additional support to workers affected by major structural changes in world trade practices.About 800 chemical workers were laid off in Estonia.I voted to support the reintegration of these redundant workers into the labor market.The Estonian authorities have provided all necessary guarantees that these people will benefit from the principle of equal treatment and that there will be no discrimination in this regard, but also that double funding will be avoided.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in the oil and chemicals sector.I support the fund's overall goal of helping workers find a job and developing their skills when they are lost due to a change in the global pattern of trade.Activities carried out under the fund include: providing a group of about 800 employees with training (including language training), career counseling, and the possibility of funding studies.I welcome the fact that concrete measures will be taken to help workers re-enter the labor market, and I have therefore voted in favor.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 28 September 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilisation of the EGF in favour of Estonia to support the reintegration in the labour market of workers made redundant. I voted in favour of this report as I believe that support should be provided to workers made redundant due to globalisation.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: in writing.- This legislative report concerns a request to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, the objective of which is to help Member States which are suffering a reduction in activities and employees in a particular professional sector.In this report, fundraising is requested for the company EGF petroleum.Considering that the EU must promote the transition of its economy towards sectors with growth and employment opportunities through support for workers made redundant, I supported this report.

name: William (The Earl of) DARTMOUTH
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this budgetary report giving consent to the use of EU funds. This vote was to approve EUR 1 131 358 (60% match funding) for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The money will be used for things like payments for the cost of training, language training (since there is a large number of Russian speakers), debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances and mobility allowances, etc. The application relates to 3 enterprises (which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products) in Estonia that made 1550 people redundant. UKIP opposes this use of EU dole money and British taxpayer’s having to pay for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Rachida DATI
text: in writing.- The European Commission's proposal for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) aims to enable Estonia to receive financial contributions from the EGF in order to support the reintegration into the labor market ofworkers made redundant in the petroleum and chemical production sector.This is the first request to mobilize the EGF from Estonia, which has brought together two economic sectors, namely the chemical industry and refining, in a single request in order to reduce administrative procedures.As Estonia has respected the conditions for granting financial contributions from the EGF and the layoffs due to the recent turbulence in the world oil market and competition from third regions with cheap gas, I voted in favor of this text.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: in writing. - I am happy that the plenary followed the position of the Committee on Budgets, of which I am a member, and voted today to grant an amount of EUR 1,131,358 intended to finance personalized services in favor of 800 over the 1,500 workers made redundant at Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS. The relatively low number of redundant workers targeted by the measures is explained by the desire to target the most vulnerable workers in the labor market and by the fact that some workers (third country nationals (63.3%)) declared that they could not participate in the actions planned by Estonia. The industries concerned are active in the coking and refining sectors and unfortunately in recent years the Union has lost its dominant position in the sales of chemicals globally to the benefit of China. In addition, due to the fall in oil prices, Estonian exports of mineral fuels in the first two months of 2016 decreased by 25% compared to the same period the previous year. Many Estonian industries are unfortunately dependent on the prices of oil and gas. Once again, this is a major problem for the future of European industry.

name: Tamás DEUTSCH
text: in writing. - Estonia has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals. Of the 1,550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF, 800 are expected to participate in the measures. The European Parliament agrees with the Commission that the conditions set out in Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under that Regulation for the following personalized services: school system in the framework of study support, financing of training costs, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, labor market vocational training, internships, debt settlement counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarships for continuing school-based studies, scholarships, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. These measures have been developed in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy and are in line with the shift towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: in writing.- The money of the Adjustment Fund should be distributed, basically, to the dismissed and not to reintegration or retraining companies because this creates specialized unemployment and does not address this situation.

name: Norbert ERDŐS
text: in writing. - Estonia has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals. Of the 1,550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF, 800 are expected to participate in the measures. The European Parliament agrees with the Commission that the conditions set out in Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under that Regulation for the following personalized services: school system in the framework of study support, financing of training costs, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, labor market vocational training, internships, debt settlement counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarships for continuing school-based studies, scholarships, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. These measures have been developed in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy and are in line with the shift towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Fredrick FEDERLEY
text: written.- Our conviction is that wealth is created through free trade and fair competition.That is why we are in principle opposed to the European Globalization Fund, which we believe is an expression of protectionism.We have previously accepted that the fund has been used as a pure emergency measure in a time of deep economic crisis, as a way to meet people's feelings of hopelessness and the exclusion that follows in the wake of the crisis and which risks further intensifying the wave of nationalism and xenophobia that is spreading.in Europe.Especially in the light of the Swedish National Audit Office's analysis, where it is believed that the fund even has a negative effect on the return to work, we believe that the fund has lost its legitimacy and should not be used anymore.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional support to workers affected by the effects of major structural changes in world trade patterns and cannot exceed the maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million.Estonia has submitted a proposal to reinstate workers made redundant in the area of the manufacture of chemicals and synthetic and artificial fibers.The application concerns the dismissal of 800 workers and envisages the mobilization of 1,131,358 euros.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - 1,550 workers were dismissed from 3 different Estonian companies, two operating in the production of shale gas, including the main energy company in the Baltic countries, and one in the production of chemicals. Only 800 of the redundant workers are expected to participate in the measures of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. Some of these workers have already been employed since this candidacy. This application will mobilize EUR 1 131 358, 60% of the estimated total cost of the proposed measures. The report proposes specific measures that will include, for example, psychological counseling and a study allowance of € 260 per month. Proposes active consultation with unions. It also proposes an Estonian language course for the Russian minority (although it is a good measure for these workers to be able to speak Estonian, this also relates to a government option that considers that 63.3% of the dismissed workers are "non-EU citizens" Since Estonia does not grant citizenship to its Russian minority, this high number actually includes Russian speakers. It is expected that the planned measures will include training for all (and covered transport to be able to participate). there is a profound change that involves a break with neoliberal policies that determine the need to mobilize this Fund.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing.- In this particular case, it is a question of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Sweden, specifically for 1556 LM Ericsson employees, and of mobilizing EUR 3 957 918 to help these employees reintegrate into the labor market.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report to help the redundant workers in the oil refining and chemical manufacturing sectors.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing.This report refers to the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.Adjustment Fund money should be allocated, in principle, to the redundant and not to reintegration or retraining companies because this creates skilled unemployment and does not address this situation.Estonia - EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ Due to the recent global oil market turbulences and to the general decrease in Europe’s international trade position for fertilizers (to the benefit of China’s producers) and low-cost gas regions outside Europe, Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS have closed down plants or reduced production resulting in the collective termination of work contracts. I believe the conditions set out in Article 4(2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that, therefore, Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under that Regulation.

name: Kinga GÁL
text: in writing. - Estonia has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals. Of the 1,550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF, 800 are expected to participate in the measures. The European Parliament agrees that Estonia is eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under the EGF Regulation for the following personalized services: financing of training costs in the framework of support for school studies, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, vocational training in the labor market, traineeships , debt settlement counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarship for continuing school - based studies, scholarship, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. These measures have been developed in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy and are in line with the shift towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: in writing. - Estonia has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals. Of the 1,550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF, 800 are expected to participate in the measures. The European Parliament agrees with the Commission that the conditions set out in Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under that Regulation for the following personalized services: school system in the framework of study support, financing of training costs, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, labor market vocational training, internships, debt settlement counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarships for continuing school-based studies, scholarships, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. These measures have been developed in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy and are in line with the shift towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy. Based on the above, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund: application EGF / 2016/003 EE / oil and chemical products.Europe and the world are immersed in a profound process of globalization that, despite being a source of trade and wealth creation, can also entail risks that we must be very attentive to.As a consequence of this process, there are sectors that are more exposed to international competition, which is why the Union must respond to those citizens who lose their jobs as a result of globalization.The European Globalization Adjustment Fund supports workers who lose their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns, caused by globalization or the global financial and economic crisis.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted in favor of the “Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (application from Estonia - EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals)”, theSupport payments to Estonia of EUR 1,131,358 - which corresponds to around 60% of the total cost of EUR 1,885,597 - for personalized services such as support for formal courses, payment of training costs, reimbursement of training costs for employers, labor market training,Work experience, debt counseling, psychological counseling, study grants for participation in formal education programs, and scholarships and travel and accommodation allowances for Estonian language courses are provided.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: written.- The European Fund for the Adjustment to Globalization (EGF) supports workers who have lost their jobs in the European Union due to structural changes in the world trade structure.Such structural changes are currently taking place in Estonia.in the manufacture of chemical products and in the coking plant and mineral oil extraction.The mineral oil production in particular is affected by severe job cuts.To help the Estonian government reintegrate the unemployed into the labor market, I support Mr Negrescu's report on the granting of EGF aid.This finances, among other things, job market training, further training measures and language courses.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- I voted in favor.It is a fund to compensate, with mainly training actions, 800 workers laid off by four Estonian companies, most of them Russian-speaking, from the petrochemical sectors, with clear problems of competitiveness with China.As we usually say, this fund does not solve the employment problem, which can only be remedied with new investment plans with sectoral transitions, but it is a mechanism that at least provides support to the victims of these processes.Alternatively, the companies that use these funds should be monitored, because one of the risks is that in practice they could be facilitating relocation processes.It does not seem the case.But it certainly leads to rethinking in terms of thinking about an alternative line to these funds.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of mobilisation of the fund, as I support giving assistance to reintegrate into the labour market workers made redundant due to major structural changes in world trade patterns, due to globalisation and the economic crisis.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 28 September 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilisation of the EGF in favour of Estonia to support the reintegration in the labour market of workers made redundant to Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS. This is the ninth application to be examined under the 2016 budget and the 2nd for the manufacture of chemicals and chemical products sector, the 1st application for the manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products sector and refers to the mobilisation of a total amount of EUR 1 131 358 from the EGF for Estonia. It concerns 800 workers made redundant. The Commission has concluded that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF.

name: András GYÜRK
text: in writing. - Estonia has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals. Of the 1,550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF, 800 are expected to participate in the measures. The European Parliament agrees with the Commission that the conditions set out in Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358 under that Regulation for the following personalized services: school studies support for the financing of training costs, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, labor market vocational training, internships, debt settlement counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarships for continuing school-based studies, scholarships, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. These measures have been developed in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy and are in line with the shift towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.- We always vote in favor of the mobilization of the CoR, since this money is used for the retraining of redundant workers and their reintegration assistance.Nevertheless, we always note that this measure is not enough.In addition to the EGF, the welfare state must be strengthened, but there must also be long-term policies to re-industrialize the countries most affected by the crisis and imposed austerity policies and memoranda.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this application to mobilise EUR 1 131 358 of the EGF for 1 550 workers in Estonia made redundant in three enterprises operating in the economic sectors of coke manufacturing, refined petroleum products and the manufacture of chemicals and chemical products across the Ida Verumaa region in Estonia. Due to Estonia’s relatively small open economy, highly reliant on exports of goods and services, which have suffered from the recent oil market turbulences and a general decrease in Europe’s international trade position, I welcome this application as Estonia’s first EGF application. Particularly the region of Ida Verumaa faces considerable challenges due to its location and demography, as it is relatively remote and has a significantly higher unemployment rate than the national average. I was very pleased to see that the application will support cofunded personalised services to the redundant workers consisting of payments for the cost of formal studies, training cost reimbursement for employers, labour market training, Estonian language training, work practice and counselling.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour since I have no objections.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: signed up.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been set up to provide additional assistance to workers affected by global restructuring as a result of the economic crisis.The request submitted by Estonia to access the amount of EUR 1 131 358 from the EGF for the reintegration into the labor market of redundant workers from Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS was adopted by the European Commission.I voted in favor of this report on support for formal education measures and the payment of training costs, for reimbursement of training costs for employers, on-the-job training, language courses, professional practice, financial and psychological counseling, allowances for participation in formal education,scholarships etc.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written. - I voted in favor of the Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request made by Estonia - EGF / 2016/003 / EE / oil and chemicals) because it supports workers affected by the global financial and economic crisis, help is needed to reintegrate into the labor market. Estonia has applied for a financial contribution from the EGF following the redundancies in the economic sectors of coke and refined petroleum products, as well as the production of chemicals and chemical products. It envisages that the measures will cover 800 out of 1,550 redundant workers who are eligible for a contribution from the EGF, by providing them with tailored services - paid training costs, compensation of training costs for employers, training for the labor market, internships, psychological counseling, fees for participation in formal education, tuition fees, travel expenses, etc. Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution in the amount of EUR 1,131,358, or 60% of the total cost of EUR 1,885,597, in accordance with this Regulation.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: in writing.- I support this initiative aimed at helping hundreds of workers made redundant by companies in the petrochemical sector to re-enter the labor market.I voted for.

name: Petr JEŽEK
text: in writing.- I supported the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) for redundancies in the oil and chemicals sector in Estonia.The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who suffer from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns or the effects of the global financial and economic crisis and to assist them with their reintegration into the labor market.I voted in favor of providing financial assistance to redundant workers through the EGF, given the significant impact on the local and regional economy.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Victor Negrescu on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.The European Globalization Adjustment Fund, created in 2006, helps people who have lost their jobs.This fund will release an envelope of 1,131,358 euros for the 1,550 redundant employees.This amount will be used to finance training, counseling and support services to promote the return to employment of these dismissed workers.I am delighted that this report was adopted by a large majority.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report, which aims to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for 1,550 workers made redundant in the economic sectors of coking, refining and the chemical industry.This fund was created to help those who find themselves impacted by certain negative consequences of globalization, for example by financing new training courses.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written.- The present application concerns the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for the dismissal of 800 workers in Estonian chemical and mineral oil companies.It should be noted that for the first time for two economic sectors in the same region the application has been merged in order to achieve less administrative costs in the implementation.For this reason, I would have approved this proposal.

name: Béla KOVÁCS
text: in writing.- Unfortunately, 1550 redundancies are taking place in the Estonian petrochemical and coke industries, so it is appropriate to award the EGF EUR 1.9 million to cover about 60% of the costs incurred, as Estonia is one of the least developed countries.However, I would like to note two things: on the one hand, the main consequence of the EU's flawed industrial policy is that China has been able to make progress in these sectors, and on the other hand that the EU is now preparing to support Ukraine in creating new competitionfor EU companies.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was set up to provide support for workers suffering the consequences of major changes in world trade.In the present case, the application concerns Estonia's request for a financial contribution following the redundancies in the coke and petroleum refining manufacturing sectors and related to the manufacture of chemicals.This is a support of EUR 1 131 358, which will help 800 redundant workers.This is a concrete measure to help European workers in need of help and retraining, and therefore I express my support.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report because it concerns aid from the Globalization Adjustment Fund to facilitate the reintegration into the labor market of 800 workers made redundant by three companies in the petrochemical sector.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: in writing.- Mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund following the request EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals from Estonia I voted for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund following therequest from Estonia regarding EE / petroleum and chemicals.The Fund should help workers made redundant from this company to re-enter the labor market.The EGF aims to disguise the consequences of the EU's trade and monetary policies and to relieve large companies of responsibility without demanding compensation.However, this aid is useful for the reintegration of workers, who should not have to submit to the free-trade whims of the European Commission.

name: Sander LOONES
text: written.- Globalization is inevitable and goes hand in hand with the opening of new markets, with international competition, with economic growth and with job creation that exceeds job losses in less competitive sectors.Consequently, there is a particular need for structural reforms to enable sustainable economic growth.This requires economic customization combined with an appropriate social policy for which, also in line with the Treaties, the member states are the first and most appropriate authorities to be competent.The N-VA delegation in the European Parliament understands the objectives of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), but is convinced that a European transfer union cannot be a remedy to tackle unemployment, nor a much needed structuralreform policy.The N-VA MEPs therefore voted against this report.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of this European Globalization Adjustment fund, maintaining a consistent position with the rest of the mobilization requests for this fund, since it may result in compensation for Estonian workers affected by the impacts of thecapitalist globalization.Being aware that this is nothing but a band-aid on a wound, these funds can bring relief to these workers, hence my positive vote.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: written.- The present request for mobilization of € 1,131,358 under the EGF, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, for Estonia, seeks to benefit 800 workers laid off from the coke oven and oil refining sector.It is worth mentioning that the EGF was created precisely to provide additional aid to workers suffering the consequences of major structural changes in world trade and that, in the specific case, these laid off workers will be offered ten types of measures.These include, for example, reimbursement of training costs to employers, training in the labor market, practical work experience, psychological help and help linked to participation in formal studies.I give my positive vote to the application as the aforementioned measures will promote employment and are compatible with the transition towards an efficient and sustainable regional economy.

name: Petr MACH
text: in writing.- I voted against.I do not agree that Estonia should receive EUR 1 million from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for payments to workers made redundant at the gas company Esti Energia.Social policy should be a matter for the Member States, and governments should not ad hoc help individual companies and workers.I consider the entire European Globalization Adjustment Fund to be a socialist redistribution of money, and I think it should be abolished.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written. - The EU has established legislative and budgetary instruments to support workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes, to help them reintegrate into the labor market. The envisaged Union financial assistance to redundant workers should be dynamic and accessible as soon as possible. As Estonia is not divided into NUTS second level regions, it is estimated that the measures will cover 800 of the 1550 redundant workers eligible for a contribution from the EGF. The Commission has determined that the conditions set out in Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358, or 60% of the total cost, for services tailored to the needs of the dismissed. workers. Estonia has applied for EGF assistance, and it has proved to be a valuable instrument to help workers from Union countries whose economies are smaller and at a disadvantage. As it is extremely important to increase the employment opportunities of all workers, I am voting in favor of this report.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: in writing. ‒ I support mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund to assist Estonia in respect of redundancies in the manufacture of petroleum and chemicals products.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of mobilisation of the fund, as I support giving assistance to reintegrate into the labour market workers made redundant due to major structural changes in world trade patterns, due to globalisation and the economic crisis.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing.- Estonia has requested EGF assistance in respect of the redundancies of 1550 employees in Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS, active in the production of coke, refined petroleum products and the production of chemicals and chemical products.These are areas affected by globalization and the shocks in the oil market.The aid will be used for personalized services and will affect 800 redundant workers.According to the rules of the EGF, Estonia is entitled to a financial contribution of EUR 1 131 358, which represents 60% of the total cost of EUR 1 885 597.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I vote in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, because it is complete and substantiated.

name: Georg MAYER
text: written.- This is where the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is to be used to support laid-off workers.In this case, I share the Commission's view that the conditions of Article 4 (2) of the EGF Regulation are met and that Estonia is therefore entitled to a financial contribution.The funds spent are used for personalized services such as support for formal training courses, payment of training costs, reimbursement of training costs for employers, labor market training, etc.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I supported the Decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (Estonian application EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemical products).2016September 28The Commission has adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the EGF for Estonia, in order to support redundancies in Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS, which are active in the economic sector (Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products) in the East.In Virumaa county.The EP agrees that Estonia fulfills all the conditions for receiving financial support of EUR 1 131 358 for workers who are vulnerable to the labor market.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing. - This is the first case of a Globalization Adjustment Fund (GEF) allocated to Estonia. It is also the first GEF to be allocated to the shale gas sector! Affected by the drop in oil and gas prices worldwide, several production sites have to close. The state is responsible for terminating these workers' contracts. In its unrestrained desire for independence from Russia, Estonia overinvested in shale gas, not listening to expert reports demonstrating the poor cost / profitability ratio given the few deposits in Europe, not to mention the threats real effects on public health and the environment of this practice (fracking). The report is satisfied with a new distribution of public money without questioning itself at all. If the training that will be provided to the redundant workers is necessary, we could also have imagined training courses encouraging retraining towards green jobs. Russian-speaking Estonians do not have access to citizenship and the report pretends to be blind. To consider 63% of Estonian licensees to be “non-European citizens” is a scandal. I am voting against this discriminatory and immoral report.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing.- This is the Globalization Adjustment Fund to help reintegrate into the labor market 800 workers made redundant by three companies in the petrochemical sector.I voted in favor of this resolution.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. - The EU is an area of ​​solidarity and it is part of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. This support is essential for helping the unemployed and the victims of relocations that occur in a globalized context. There is an increasing number of companies relocating, taking advantage of the low labor prices that are practiced in several countries, namely in China and India, with harmful effects for countries that respect workers' rights. The EGF is intended to help workers who are victims of company relocation. The EGF has already been used in the past by other EU countries, and it is now up to Estonia to submit this application, which submitted the application 'EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals' to a financial contribution from the EGF, following redundancies economic sector classified in division 19 of NACE Rev. 2 (Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products) and division 20 (Manufacture of chemical products); Estonia is not divided into NUTS level 2 regions and 800 of the 1 550 redundant workers eligible for the EGF contribution are expected to participate in the measures. Hence my vote in favor.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) is one of the tools at the Union’s disposal to provide additional assistance to workers negatively impacted upon by major structural changes in world trade patterns. The Commission approved this specific application as it met the conditions for mobilising EGF to support the local economy. I therefore voted in favour of this report to help address the situation of workers in the petroleum and chemical industry in Estonia.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 11 May 2016, Estonia submitted to the Commission an application to mobilize the Fund, concerning redundancies in Estonia at Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS. The measures affect around 800 of the 1550 redundant workers, as they aim to target those made redundant who are particularly vulnerable in the labor market, and some workers have stated that they are unable to take part in the measures. The following personalized services are to be provided to redundant workers: financing of training costs in the framework of support for school-based studies, reimbursement of vocational training costs for employers, labor market vocational training, internships, debt management counseling, psychological counseling, study scholarships for school-based studies, scholarships, transport and housing support for Estonian language training. The Commission has determined that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the Fund, and that the planned measures constitute active labor market measures within the eligible actions, and has therefore submitted to Parliament and the Council a proposal for a financial contribution from the Fund of EUR 1 131 358. I supported the proposal.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. - The EGF was created for the purpose of providing additional support to workers affected by the effects of major structural changes in world trade patterns. In the present case, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in favor of Estonia, to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant in the economic sector classified in division 19 of NACE Rev. 2 (Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products) and division 20 (Manufacture of chemical products). Estonia is not divided into NUTS level 2 regions and 800 of the 1 550 redundant workers eligible for the EGF contribution are expected to participate in the measures. I endorse the importance of improving the employability of all dismissed workers through adapted training and the recognition of qualifications and skills acquired throughout their professional careers, and I consider it vital that the proposed training is adapted, not only to the needs of the dismissed workers, but also to the real business environment.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing.- The assistance provided by the Globalization Adjustment Fund is useful.I'm voting for.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: in writing.- I voted for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund requested following the layoffs at Petroleum and Chemicals in Estonia.The European Globalization Adjustment Fund intervenes to support workers made redundant due to major changes in the structure of world trade resulting from globalization, due to the persistence of the global financial and economic crisis or due to a newglobal financial and economic crisis.In this case, the amount of the EGF mobilized amounts to 1,331,358 euros for 1,550 eligible beneficiaries.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ On the 11 May 2016, Estonia submitted an EGF application for a financial contribution from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund. As rapporteur for this file I have voted for this report that will mobilise EUR 1 131 358 from the EGF to help 800 workers made redundant by providing them with personalised services consisting of labour market services, work practice, debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowance relating to the participants in formal studies, mobility allowance, training cost reimbursement and support for formal studies.

name: Momchil NEKOV
text: In written form. - The case of Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS in Estonia is indicative of how vulnerable European workers are in the context of structural changes in world trade patterns. These companies, which until recently held leading positions in Europe and the world, had to reduce their production due to external factors such as falling oil prices and the weakening of the EU's international trade position. Thus, once again, skilled European workers found themselves out of work. In this context, I give my support to the granting of aid through the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. The Fund will provide training for redundant workers, which will help them to be an active part of the Estonian economy again. I believe that the EU must speed up the provision of financial assistance to alleviate the shock suffered by Estonian workers and their families.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report because for the first time two economic sectors in the same regions have been brought together to apply for the money so that there will also be fewer administrative costs involved in implementation.

name: Urmas PAET
text: in writing.- I supported.Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS submitted an application to assist the successful return of 800 redundant workers to the labor market.For the first time, Estonia applied for EGF support.The fund supports services for those who have suffered redundancies.Services include training, Estonian language courses, internships, debt counseling, study grants and transport and accommodation benefits.

name: Demetris PAPADAKIS
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the report which provides for the support of the European Adjustment Fund for Estonia and the reintegration of workers laid off by Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS, as the country's application meets the conditions for the financial contribution from the European Adjustment Fund and the Estonian authorities have provided all the necessary assurances requested. With this grant, the dismissed employees will have access to personalized services such as a) Support for formal studies - payment of formal studies, b) Reimbursement of training costs for employers, c) Training in the labor market, d) Teaching the Estonian language , e) Internship at work, g) Psychological support, h) Scholarship and travel and residence allowance for learning the Estonian language, so that with this help they will be able to re-enter the labor market.

name: Margot PARKER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this budgetary report giving consent to the use of EU funds. This vote was to approve EUR 1 131 358 (60% match funding) for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The money will be used for things like payments for the cost of training, language training (since there is a large number of Russian speakers), debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances and mobility allowances, etc. The application relates to 3 enterprises (which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products) in Estonia that made 1550 people redundant. UKIP opposes this use of EU dole money and British taxpayer’s having to pay for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing.- With regard to the proposal under consideration, I felt it my duty to express myself in favor.The effects that can derive from globalization, in certain circumstances, can be negative in scope.The Union has put in place legislative and budgetary instruments to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major changes in the structure of world trade or the global economic and financial crisis, as well as to assist them in their reintegration into the labor market.The Union, therefore, undertakes to alleviate what may be such types of effects through immediate and effective financial support.Therefore, I voted positively.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: written. - As the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) was set up to provide additional support to workers facing the consequences of major structural changes in world trade, the EGF mobilization proposal in favor of Estonia to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers are declared redundant, the fund fulfills exactly what it exists for. The request refers to 800 workers who have been declared redundant, and provides: support for formal education; reimbursement of training costs for employers; labor market training; learning the Estonian language; work practice; debt counseling; psychological counseling; compensation for participation in formal education; tuition, travel expenses and accommodation allowance while learning Estonian; mobility allowance. The welfare of workers should always come first, so everything necessary should be done to get laid off workers back to the labor market. Given that the application qualifies for a financial contribution from the EGF and that the package of proposed measures is in line with the needs set out in the Estonian Regional Development Strategy 2014-2020. and that the Estonian authorities have provided all the necessary guarantees, I support this proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in favor of Estonia.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing.- Once again, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is used in the short term to prevent employees who suffer from the EU's globalist policies from immediately finding themselves in poverty.I regret that no real change has been made to European policy, but I vote in favor of this aid which benefits workers.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written. - The Estonian economy, which relies heavily on exports of goods and services, has been severely affected by the recent turmoil in the world oil market and Europe's general deteriorating position in international trade. The EU has lost its leading position in global chemical sales and has been taken over by China with a growing presence in the rest of Asia as well as the US. The EU has put in place legislative and budgetary instruments to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns and the financial and economic crisis. On 28 September 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the EGF in favor of Estonia to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers declared redundant in three companies in Ida-Viru County. Estonia's decision to merge the two economic sectors into one regional application is commendable, given that the redundancies took place in the same region, thus reducing the administrative burden and enabling the organization of joint measures for redundant workers in both sectors. Assistance to redundant workers should be dynamic and available as quickly and efficiently as possible. I am of the opinion that the EGF could be a particularly valuable instrument to help workers from Union countries whose economies are smaller and at a disadvantage.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing.- Estonia submitted the application 'EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals' to a financial contribution from the EGF, following the dismissals of 1 550 workers.This perverse instrument, intended to cover the effects of capitalism, deserves our condemnation.Our vote in favor only stems from our solidarity with workers who are victims of a system that is fed by the EU, with the consequences of which we end up dealing with every session and every day in each country.

name: Pavel POC
text: in writing. - In Estonia, there were collective redundancies of up to 1,550 employees working in three chemical companies. For this reason, I voted in favor of the necessary mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, which was created for similar situations. The Estonian economy has been shaken by developments in the global oil market and alternative and cheaper imports of products from outside the European Union. Estonia has met all the necessary criteria for support from this fund. I therefore voted to provide redundant workers with assistance of around EUR 1.1 million. More specifically, it will provide individual assistance and support in connection with further studies, training, counseling and contributions to transport and accommodation in self-development. I also supported that not only central authorities but also regional authorities be involved in the implementation of the measures. Also representatives of employees and employers. I believe that these funds will help the most vulnerable group of redundant workers to find new jobs and thus contribute to the diversification of trade, which accounts for more than three quarters of the Estonian economy. I also believe that the funds that will be provided to Estonia until 2019 will mitigate the effects that redundancies in the chemical industry have had on other sectors, including manufacturing, mining and energy.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: in writing.- I am very pleased that this time the funds from the Globalization Fund are going to the so-called new member state.I have repeatedly pointed out the imbalance in this regard, and finally there is a shift in this matter.

name: Franck PROUST
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), created in 2006, helps people who have lost their jobs as a result of structural changes in international trade, such as relocations or closures ofcompanies.I voted for this fund to be mobilized to help the 1,550 former dismissed employees of an Estonian chemical company.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created with the aim of guaranteeing complementary support for workers affected by the effects of structural changes in world trade patterns. Since it was created, the Fund has allowed thousands of newly unemployed people to access professional counseling services for reintegration into the labor market, thus providing support for the creation of their own businesses and new education and training opportunities. The application to the Fund, in order to support the reintegration, in the labor market, of 800 workers made redundant by the companies Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS was presented to the Commission on September 28, 2016. This is the ninth application examined under the 2016 budget and relates to the mobilization of a total amount of EUR 1 131 358 from the EGF to Estonia. The Commission has concluded, in accordance with the applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF. For the above, I vote in favor.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this budgetary report giving consent to the use of EU funds. This vote was to approve EUR 1 131 358 (60% match funding) for 800 redundant workers in Estonia. The money will be used for things like payments for the cost of training, language training (since there is a large number of Russian speakers), debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowances and mobility allowances, etc. The application relates to 3 enterprises (which manufacture chemicals and petroleum products) in Estonia that made 1550 people redundant. UKIP opposes this use of EU dole money and British taxpayer’s having to pay for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Sofia RIBEIRO
text: in writing. - I voted in favor, as I consider the Commission's proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in favor of Estonia to be important in order to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant by the companies Eesti Energia AS, Nitrofert AS and Viru Keemia Grupp AS, operating in the economic sector of chemicals and synthetic and artificial fibers, in the Ida-Virumaa region. According to the Commission, the personalized services to be provided to the dismissed workers, are active measures of the labor market that are part of the eligible actions defined in article 7 of the EGF Regulation. However, these actions are not a substitute for passive social protection measures. In addition, the proposed package of measures is in line with the needs identified in Estonia's regional development strategy 2014-2020, as well as in the Ida-Virumaa Action Plan for 2015-2020. The Estonian authorities further declare that the coordinated package of measures is compatible with the move towards a resource-efficient and sustainable economy and has great potential to facilitate it.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request submitted by Estonia - EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleumand chemicals).Indeed, the mobilization of the Globalization Adjustment Fund (GEF) is essential to provide additional assistance to workers suffering the consequences of restructuring as in the case of ESSTI ENERGIA AS, NITROFERT and VIRU KEEMIA GRUPPAS.This is a real social and solidarity added value of the Union which directly benefits workers.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: in writing.- The idea of supporting the polluting oil and chemical industry with EU money seems a bit strange.However, given that this non-organic industry has not withstood the pressures of the market and globalization, and that ordinary workers have fallen victim to this, this case is an excellent example for which the EGF has been created.I really want to believe that the support provided will also help the emergence of new green businesses.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: written.- I voted in favor.It is a fund to compensate, with mainly training actions, 800 workers laid off by four Estonian companies, most of them Russian-speaking, from the petrochemical sectors, with clear problems of competitiveness with China.As we usually say, this fund does not solve the employment problem, which can only be remedied with new investment plans with sectoral transitions, but it is a mechanism that at least provides support to the victims of these processes.Alternatively, the companies that use these funds should be monitored, because one of the risks is that in practice they could be facilitating relocation processes.It does not seem the case.But it certainly leads to rethinking in terms of thinking about an alternative line to these funds.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of this European Globalization Adjustment fund, maintaining a consistent position with the rest of the mobilization requests for this fund, since it may result in compensation for Estonian workers affected by the impacts of thecapitalist globalization.Being aware that this is nothing but a band-aid on a wound, these funds can bring relief to these workers, hence my positive vote.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing.- I fully support measures aimed at setting policies that create growth and jobs.However, I do not consider the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to be the right and effective tool for these policies.That is why I voted against.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing. - I agreed to the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for the Estonian Government because of the redundancies in Estonia due to negative developments in the global oil and chemicals market. The Globalization Adjustment Fund is intended to assist Member States in the event of large-scale redundancies not directly affected by businesses. At the same time, several companies in Estonia were forced to lay off a total of 1,550 employees. These are mainly the consequences of the recent turmoil in the world oil market, but the situation is also linked to the general deterioration of Europe's position in international fertilizer trade and competition from non-European regions producing low-cost gas. The Union has recently been exposed to strong competition from China and has gradually lost its leading position in the global sale of chemicals, as this position is occupied by China. For these reasons, I agree with the release of more than EUR 1.1 million for the 800 redundant workers who will be involved in these measures. This will cover up to 60 percent of the costs that Estonia will have to incur in training, training, work experience, consultancy or transport and housing allowances. As such circumstances can affect any Member State of the Union, the Globalization Fund is an important tool to offset these market fluctuations.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: written. - I have the resolution of the EU Parliament on the "Proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (application from Estonia - EGF / 2016/003 EE / petroleum and chemicals)" not accepted. We are constantly making decisions about subsidies from this fund. The EGF has a maximum annual budget of 150 million euros for the period 2014-2020. I basically reject this fund as a waste of taxpayers' money. The fund subsidizes support measures if a company with its business model has not been able to hold its own against the competition. The fund also means that competencies of the EU have been exceeded. It is absurd to adopt such rescue measures in the event of the competitiveness of sole proprietorships or industries at EU level rather than nationally. That is at least a violation of the subsidiarity principle and also a violation of economic policy lessons. The European Fund for Adjustment to Globalization should be closed and wound up immediately.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: written.- The European Union has put in place some instruments to provide additional support to workers affected by the economic crisis and major changes in international trade, to help them re-enter the labor market.One of the envisaged instruments is the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF).Large layoffs affect the local and regional economy, especially in countries whose economies are smaller and at a disadvantage.The purpose of the EGF is to provide financial assistance to redundant workers.In the event that Estonia applies for the mobilization of the EGF, Parliament agrees with the Commission that the conditions laid down for Estonia to qualify for financial assistance for services tailored to the needs of the redundant workers are met.Therefore, I support the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.

name: Patricija ŠULIN
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.In the economic sector of coke and petroleum products production, redundancies have taken place in Estonia, and Estonia has applied for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.800 to 1550 redundancies are expected to take part in the measures.As Estonia fulfills all the conditions to obtain funding from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, I supported the report.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: in writing.- We always vote in favor of the mobilization of the CoR, since this money is used for the retraining of redundant workers and their reintegration assistance.Nevertheless, we always note that this measure is not enough.In addition to the EGF, the welfare state must be strengthened, but there must also be long-term policies to re-industrialize the countries most affected by the crisis and imposed austerity policies and memoranda.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: in writing.- The money of the Adjustment Fund should be distributed, basically, to the dismissed and not to reintegration or retraining companies because this creates specialized unemployment and does not address this situation.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: in writing.- I voted for the text, Europe must continue to advocate its values of solidarity.This is the ninth application considered under Budget 2016, the second on the chemical industry and the first on coking and refining;it concerns the mobilization of a total amount of EUR 1,131,358 from the EGF for Estonia.This request concerns 800 dismissed workers, a new social drama.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ Estonia is a small open economy with a high reliance on exports of goods and services.
